com.example.hotpot0.section2.controllers

Class EventActionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.hotpot0.section2.controllers.EventActionHandler

  • public class EventActionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles user actions related to events such as joining or leaving waitlists, accepting or declining invitations, and managing event-user relationships.

    This class provides asynchronous methods that interact with EventDB, ProfileDB, and EventUserLinkDB to perform these operations using callback-based responses.

      • EventActionHandler

    • Method Detail

      • joinWaitList

        public void joinWaitList(java.lang.Integer userID,
                         java.lang.Integer eventID,
                         java.lang.Double latitude,
                         java.lang.Double longitude,
                         ProfileDB.GetCallback<java.lang.Integer> callback)
        Allows a user to join an event’s waitlist if they are not already affiliated with the event and the waitlist is not full.
        Parameters:
        userID - the user’s ID
        eventID - the event’s ID
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:
        • onSuccess(0) – successfully joined waitlist
        • onSuccess(1) – user already affiliated
        • onSuccess(2) – waitlist is full
        • onFailure(e) – failure during database operation

      • leaveWaitList

        public void leaveWaitList(java.lang.Integer userID,
                          java.lang.Integer eventID,
                          ProfileDB.GetCallback<java.lang.Integer> callback)
        Removes a user from an event’s waitlist.

        The method deletes the associated EventUserLink and removes the link reference from both the user’s profile and the event record.

        Parameters:
        userID - the user’s ID
        eventID - the event’s ID
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:
        • onSuccess(0) – successfully removed
        • onSuccess(1) – user not on waitlist
        • onFailure(e) – failure during database operation

      • acceptInvite

        public void acceptInvite(java.lang.Integer userID,
                         java.lang.Integer eventID,
                         ProfileDB.GetCallback<java.lang.Integer> callback)
        Allows a user to accept an invitation to an event.

        Only users with the "Sampled" status can accept an invitation. Upon acceptance, the status is updated to "Accepted".

        Parameters:
        userID - the user’s ID
        eventID - the event’s ID
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:
        • onSuccess(0) – successfully accepted invite
        • onSuccess(1) – user not eligible
        • onFailure(e) – failure during update

      • declineInvite

        public void declineInvite(java.lang.Integer userID,
                          java.lang.Integer eventID,
                          ProfileDB.GetCallback<java.lang.Integer> callback)
        Allows a user to decline an invitation to an event.

        Only users with the "Sampled" status can decline an invitation. Upon declining, the status is updated to "Declined".

        Parameters:
        userID - the user’s ID
        eventID - the event’s ID
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:
        • onSuccess(0) – successfully declined invite
        • onSuccess(1) – user not eligible
        • onFailure(e) – failure during update

      • cancelUser

        public void cancelUser(Event event,
                       java.lang.Integer userID,
                       ProfileDB.GetCallback<java.lang.Integer> callback)
        Allows an organizer to cancel their participation in an event.

        The user's status is updated to "Cancelled", and the event record is updated to reflect the cancellation.

        Parameters:
        userID - the user’s ID
        event - the event object
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:
        • onSuccess(0) – successfully cancelled participation
        • onSuccess(1) – user not affiliated
        • onFailure(e) – failure during update

      • sendCustomNotification

                                   java.lang.String status,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> linkIDs,
                                   Event event,
                                   EventUserLinkDB.ActionCallback callback)
        Sends a custom notification to a list of users associated with an event.
        Parameters:
        message - the notification message
        status - the status associated with the notification
        linkIDs - the list of EventUserLink IDs representing the recipients
        event - the event object
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:

                            Event event,
                            EventUserLinkDB.ActionCallback callback)
        Confirms a list of entrants for an event by updating their status to "Accepted" and adding a notification to their EventUserLink.
        Parameters:
        linkIDs - the list of EventUserLink IDs representing the entrants
        event - the event object
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:

      • exportEntrantsToCSV

        public void exportEntrantsToCSV(java.util.List<java.lang.String> linkIDs,
                                java.lang.String eventName,
                                EventActionHandler.ExportCallback callback)
        Exports a list of event entrants to a CSV format string.
        Parameters:
        linkIDs - the list of EventUserLink IDs representing the entrants
        eventName - the name of the event
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:
        • onSuccess(csvData) – successfully generated CSV data
        • onFailure(e) – failure during export

      • deleteEventLinks

        public void deleteEventLinks(java.lang.Integer eventID,
                             EventDB.ActionCallback callback)
        Deletes all links associated with an event, including user links, profile references, and event images.
        Parameters:
        eventID - the event's ID
        callback - callback invoked upon completion:
        • onSuccess() – successfully deleted all links
        • onFailure(e) – failure during deletion
